title: Israelgogo
author: Israelgogo
content: People intend to use the word "ugly" alot and fail to realise nobody is ugly ,A parent cannot reject their all because people claims the child is ugly rather they will love the child regardly of what people think.I often said it that no woman is ugly ,the real beauty of a woman unveils when money is spent her ,So as a man take yours and create the beauty you so desire by spending on her. Those beautiful ladies you see were inspired by someone's money to transform her.Likewise yourself, you are not ugly ,the moment you start to see yourself as beautiful and as relevant enough then you can control others opinion about you, think less what they say about you, spent money on yourself to look good then people will be surprised at how you tranformed for good.Command some respect and values to yourself.

comments.author: Honnet43
comments.body: Beautiful and ugly are relative subjective terms. What is beautiful for one is ugly for another.You claim to take away from people the right to consider other people or things beautiful or ugly, because everyone has the right to do so.

comments.author: mich
comments.body: When it comes to physical beauty I believe no one is ugly. Being beautiful is about radiating a positive attitude and being good to others. Every human is unique and we all have special qualities and something to contribute. And physical beauty is definitely distinct from being attracted to somebody. On the other hand, a person can be ugly if they treat others without respect and dignity.

comments.author: Tallupooh
comments.body: all humans are not ugly. but everyone has their own type.treat others the way you want to be treated by others.

comments.author: DeathAngel
comments.body: Nice positive post, I like it. Some might be more aesthetically pleasing than others, that is true but calling somebody ugly is so nasty. Beauty is in the eye of the beholder & there is somebody out there for everybody.Looks don’t last forever, they fade with age so it’s always best to look for a potential partner who is great on the inside too.

comments.body: The author of the topic is good, these days we need to talk about it more often, because many people think in the wrong way

comments.author: Stella Mese
comments.body: i think so too. that everything is nothing bad. but it is everyone's different judgment that makes assumptions about something. Even everyone's tastes are different. But when our tastes and other people are different. then it does not mean that our tastes are right and other people's tastes are wrong. but our tastes are true for us and other people's tastes are true for others. also in the evaluation of other things.

comments.author: Sanni_w
comments.body: Let me tell you a secret, I always see myself ugly, I do not like watching myself in the mirror, I lack self confidence, I can not talk in public and you know what, am not even ugly. I am trying my best to overcome my lack of confidence

comments.author: Raceonsucced
comments.body: actually there is nothing ugly in this world. the only bad thing is other people's comments about us. what makes us complicated, is thinking too much about other people.we always want to be liked by many people, so we don't know our true identity.we must first know ourselves, and correct mistakes little by little.

comments.author: Qiubell5
comments.body: complain less, be grateful. all creatures are created in the best form.don't ever feel that we are very ugly, think for a moment that we are all created with the best version of each. So, never compare yourself with others.

comments.author: Ucy
comments.body: Well, it's important to love everyone equally both the beautiful and the unattractive ones. But it's important not to reject the fact that there are actually people who are more attractive than others even in animal world. But sometimes I feel like being attractive/beautiful is a curse because of how difficult it's to be normal without living fake life pretending to be what you are not when you know you sometimes stink & poop like others.  However, I tend to focus more on the inner beauty than outer appearance. There are ugly people who just melt my heart when they speak or behave, while the behavior or speech of those who appear beautiful could make you not to want anything to do with people with similar beautiful appearance. I tend to think that our CREATOR could hide good things in things that appear ugly for those with wisdom to find them. No need to envy beautiful/handsome people too much as it's not really easy to live normal life (from my experience) in the midst of people who aren't so attractive

comments.author: BADecker
comments.body: Everybody is ugly. Consider how long people last. Only 100 years if that. Beauty and youth are simply distractions from reality.

comments.author: Ayannare
comments.body: Everything in this world is an illusion, for some it is beautiful and for others it is not.

comments.author: Car52

comments.author: Kath Bliss
comments.body: I completely agree with this statement. No one is ugly and it is important for us to remember that beauty lies within each of us. As the saying goes, "You are more than what meets the eye." We should all strive to boost our self-esteem and confidence, because this is all that really matters in the end. When we take time and effort to value ourselves, others will too.

comments.author: Islam_09
comments.body: There are, of course, standards of beauty, but I agree that every person is beautiful in his or her own way.

comments.author: Meild_09

comments.author: henrytheeight
comments.body: Beauty is a subjective concept, and everyone has their own unique features and qualities that make them attractive in their own way. While some people may conform to societal beauty standards, it's important to remember that there is no objective measure of beauty. What one person finds attractive may be different from what someone else finds appealing. Additionally, physical appearance is just one aspect of a person's overall beauty. Personality traits such as kindness, humor, intelligence, and confidence can also contribute to someone's beauty. So, it's safe to say that nobody is truly ugly, and everyone has their own unique beauty that is worthy of celebration.
